rComments: Ask for help? You definitely won't get a proper response. He gets annoyed when students email him. Very unclear instructions especially considering that there aren't any prerequisites so not all students have an anthropology and archaeology background. He thinks his opinion is only right. Content is easy for me but still an annoying class to take.

Easy to read + interesting textbook. Lectures are pretty much a review of the assigned chapter of the week + a little bit of the research he has worked on in the past. The formatting of the lecture slides are awful though. Lectures are a little bit boring. The exam consisted of 16 short answer questions + 3 essays. My hand died 3 times

Loved Prof. Crawford! He is very passionate about what he teaches which makes the lectures enjoyable. Exams and Assignments are straightforward. If you read the material and good at memorizing stories, you'll definitely do well in this class.
V funny n passionate abt what he's teaching! also an overall cute n pure human. 10/10.
Just an overall sweetheart! The course was easy and engaging! 10/10 would take a class just because he is teaching it

This prof is wack. He's passionate about hoaxes, but he's condescending. He sends emails like, "don't ask me to increase your mark, it's an academic offence" which it's not. People leave early in class and he actually gets upset as if we don't have other things to attend too. I've had to fight him in emails, which he never responded too. Just wack.

Prof. Crawford gives off a very kindhearted vibe. He is engaging and humourous. In fact, during our last lecture he showed us all a meme. Some lectures get boring and hard to follow so you have to come prepared and read beforehand. Also. he never emphasizes what is important for the test or exam or reveal any hints when people ask.

Gary Crawford is a nice person and always tries to engage students by being enthusiastic and funny. It is clear that he is passionate about the subject he's teaching. Although attending class is interesting and informative, solely going to lectures is not enough to get high marks. Questions on tests and exams are directly from extensive readings.
very interesting course, i couldn't care less about archeology but this course built a genuine interest.

To get a good grade: Send emails to him frequently (once/week) about topics related to the course. Ex: the Blood of Jesus found on top of the Ark. Find and talk about things are a mystery/hoax/etc like the content of the course is. He will see that you are interested in the course, and he will give you an UNEARNED good grade. He did for me anyway.

PROFESSOR CRAWFORD IS THE BEST PROFESSOR I HAVE EVER HAD!!! He is hilarious, has very interesting and engaging lectures and is always there to help. Tests are 100% FAIR and exam is VERY fair. Recommend this course to everyone.

Great prof. The content is very straight forward and pretty simple to grasp. Show up to class and listen and you'll do well. There's one midterm quiz (all mc), a short writing assignment, participation online and the final.
He's was not clear when answering questions about the assignment, midterm, and exam... Especially the exam -_-
he does not respond quickly to questions posted on the discussion board, To do well

Had him for the fantasies and hoaxes class. He's very sweet an d always tries his best to make the class interesting and enjoyable, although it can be boring sometimes, but other times I'd be all ears. Never bought the book and I got 75. His ppts are very brief, so you HAVE TO ATTEND CLASS, otherwise you'll be like a deer in headlights.

Prof. Crawford is very kind and desires for his students to  succeed. Any student who complains about his course or teaching must first criticize their own performance as a student because his course is interesting and very straight forward. It is very possible to succeed if you care enough to. When you go to his office he wants to help you!
the course title soudns very interesting; the professor is eloquent but there is not much substance in the lectures. And his mysterious voice did make you curious sometimes.

The class was interesting. It was difficult to stay awake in a 10AM class. I didn't buy the textbook and I'm currently at a 70% in the course. Definitly go to class. Don't make my mistake. I rarely went, and when I did, I barely took any notes.
The most interesting archaeology course you will ever take! ANDDDD... it is taught by the kindest professor you will ever meet!!!!

The course is a bit boring imo, but his mysterious voice can keep you awake. Test aren't too bad, but the first test only had 30 MC! That's way too little for a test worth 30%! Uses different types of videos in class. Attendance is a must.
not always encourage students to talk,highly defensive and self rightous
Not a bad course, but the lectures are really boring. The sad part is if you don't attend them, you're pretty much not doing well on the final. I wouldn't take another course with him.
Extremely difficult tests and term paper is graded harshy. To make matters worse, his lectures are dull and boring

Very eloquent and understandable. Will stray from the powerpoint but will grade fairly. Do the readings beforehand to appreciate fully. Inspiring professor, with a well-mannered and professional attitude that puts everyone at ease.
okay prof, boring
Great professor
yawn

A really great professor. Very cool. Love the way talks. Helped develop my analytical abilities and writing skills. Go to class. Focus on lectures and do the readings for the assignment. He is very helpful and open to questions about the material. He is also the department head. The same goes for his ANT327 course on plant and animal domestication.
awesome
He an ok professor, a bit boring sometimes.

So disorganized.  Just ignore the powerpoints and listen to what he has to say, because the charts and pictures he puts up are at best irrelevant and at worst confusing.  His tests are fair and easy, but focus heavily on East Asia.
